lexUnit.name: concoct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: create or devise (a story or plan)

sentence.text: If nuclear Iraq is an Israeli scare concocted to distract attention from Palestine , it is an own-goal .
I wonder what the good doctor and his housekeeper make of her -- and what story she has concocted to explain her presence there ?
THE Government was accused yesterday of concocting a fudged list to gloss over the real dangers of microwave ovens found to be faulty in its own tests .
So she had concocted this marvellous plan to spike Jenny 's guns .

( The couple are charged with using Philippine Government funds to buy art and US real estate , concocting elaborate schemes to conceal their ownership and trying to sell the assets and evade taxes . )
His own knowledge of dissection also paid dividends , allowing him to concoct remedies against rheumatism made from the fat of his hanged victims .
Dotty concocted alarming potions from the herbs and these she pressed upon her unwilling neighbours and friends if they were unwary enough to admit to any slight ailment in her presence .
THIS week 's winner of our Witty Ad of the Week competition , Mrs Terry Jones , has concocted a fine recipe for selling her London flat .
Should she concoct some story about him having a violently contagious disease ?
This is because much of the skill of an aromatherapist lies in his or her ability to concoct wonderful aromas by mixing and blending vegetable oils and fragrant essences .
I shall go garbed as a maidservant and , if seen and questioned , shall concoct a tale about having a message for one of the guards .
It was he actually whom Simon had asked to be the co-respondent--bogus co-respondent--when they were concocting their divorce , it was about him that the judge had scolded her and given me to Anna .

Downstairs kitchen staff worked with a variety of so called " labour saving devices " to concoct a host of culinary delights .
Dr William Najaar has concocted a mint-flavoured mouth-wash .
Our daily bread is concocted by chemists who do not sleep easy at night .
You ca n't but peek at them just to be titillated , not really believing what they are saying , since they are concocted by charlatans .
During the next two days the Hoare-Laval Pact was concocted .
Complicated and delicious meals had always found their way to the table , and she had enjoyed them without ever bothering to find out how they were concocted .
Meanwhile , a screenplay was being concocted from Henri Charrire 's 1969 semi-autobiographical bestseller Papillon .
He kept this strange fallibility from almost everybody he knew , concocting details if he was pressed hard .
As she had fantasised about Vitor rethinking , so her foster brother seemed to have concocted a dream world of his own , Ashley thought bemusedly .
Only eight weeks into the job , Mr Gerstner is still concocting a rescue plan .
Lynn Bari , who was born Marjorie Schuyler Fisher on December 18th 1913 in Roanoke , Virginia , concocted her screen name from that of the actress Lynn Fontane and author James Barrie .
Over the years there have been a great number of electronic games concocted for the hobbyist , including one or two cricket games .

Coffee was a nauseous substitute concocted from acorns ; bread had already been rationed by the beginning of 1915 to about 2 Ibs a week , and goodness knows what was added to the flour to make it so grey and gritty !
Much of the real figure is concealed by half-baked schemes concocted by his Department , which do not reveal the real position .
It is not impossible that S 985 is simply a forgery concocted by Eadui to protect his church from the demands of royal officials .
The latter part of the above signal refers to a plan that Stirling had concocted with the RAF during his last brief visit to Cairo .

A dresser holds a collection of old tins that once contained pills for headaches , stomach and liver ailments , concocted by Tim 's great-grandfather , a manufacturing chemist who set up in business in the 1880s .
` Brodetto " is a traditional fish soup concocted from up to a dozen different kinds of fish with their flavours enriched with generous use of olive oil , onion , herbs and garlic .
The complex series of financial switches , deceptions and double deals they concocted were far more extensive than any of the comparatively small scams that took place in the US .
And she was initially awed by the plots which the girls concocted as they sought to shame a particular teacher or fellow pupil , or simply to escape at impermissible hours from the school grounds .
Whatever scheme his devious brain was concocting was doomed to failure .
